intro: Hieracium molybdinum, commonly known as the leadplant hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It has rough, hairy leaves and produces yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in summer. Hieracium molybdinum is often considered a weed but can serve as a food source for certain insects.
